title: CTRL0000083775 - Transcribed Interview of Charlie Kirk, (May 24, 2022)

data.text: SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE
JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES,
WASHINGTON, D.C.
DEPOSITION OF:
CHARLES KIRK
Tuesday, May 24, 2022
Washington, D.C.
The deposition in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 10:01
a.m.
Present:
Representative Kinzinger.
Appearances:
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
STAFF ASSOCIATE
INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
FINANCIAL INVESTIGATOR
For CHARLES KIRK:
JOSHUA LEVY
JEFF NEIMAN
JULIANA ANDONIAN
This is a deposition conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the
We're on the record.
January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol.
At this time, I would ask the witness to state and spell your name for the record.
The Witness.
Could you please raise your hand so that you could be sworn in for the
Charles Kirk, C-h-a-r-1-e-s K-i-r-k.
Thank you, Mr. Kirk.
deposition?
The Reporter.
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury
that the testimony you are about to give will be the truth, the whole truth, and nothing
but the truth?
The Witness.
Thank you.
I do.
Mr. Kirk, my name i s _ , and I am the investigative counsel who's
designated by the select committee to lead this deposition.
us questions or ask questions at any point.
right now.
Members may join and ask
I don't see that any members are with us
If they do join, we'll acknowledge that they've arrived.
Otherwise, the only other person from the investigative staff who's joining us is
who's an investigator with our team.
We do have an official reporter here with us.
Today we're going to be following the House deposition rules that we previously
provided to your counsel with the subpoena that came to you.
you are permitted to have an attorney present.
And under those rules,
At this time, I'd ask that your counsel identify themselves for the record.
Mr. Neiman.
Good morning.
This is Jeff Neiman.
Mr. Levy.
Ms. Andonian.
Under House deposition rules neither committee members nor staff may discuss
Joshua Levy.
Juliana Andonian.
Thank you.
the substance of your testimony today unless and until the committee approves the
release of the testimony.
Mr. Kirk, you and your attorneys will have an opportunity to review the transcript.
Before we begin, I'd like to touch on a few ground rules and see if you have any
questions before we get started.
The first is we have an official reporter who's going to be transcribing the record
of this deposition.
transcription is going to be the official record of the proceeding.
We also are recording the Webex feed, but the reporter's
And for that reason, it's important that we not talk over each other.
So I'd ask
that you wait until I finish asking a question before you respond and I will do my best to
wait to ask a question until your response is complete.
The reporter cannot note any nonverbal responses.
So although we're looking at
each other over these cameras, it's appropriate for you to give yes-or-no answers, for
example, rather than shaking or nodding your head.
If you have to spell something that we don't know -- sorry.
spell something if you're using a word that we don't know how to spell.
simply for the benefit of the record and the court reporter.
I might ask you to
That's really
All that we ask of you today, Mr. Kirk, as with any witness, is that you provide
complete answers to the best of your recollection.
If a question is not clear, just say so and I will do my best to rephrase it.
If you
don't know an answer, you can simply say so.
You may refuse to answer a question only to preserve a privilege that is
recognized by the select committee.
a privilege, we can do a couple of things.
If you refuse to answer a question that's based on
One is, we can proceed with the deposition and come back to that question later,
or we can seek a ruling from the chairman of the select committee on the objection.
And under the House's rules, if the chairman overrules your objection, you would be
required to answer.
Finally, I remind you, as we do with all witnesses, that it is unlawful to deliberately
provide false information to Congress and doing so could result in criminal penalties.
Mr. Kirk, do you understand all the ground rules I've just covered?
The Witness.
EXAMINATION
Yes.
BY
Q
Now, I'd like to begin the deposition by outlining a little bit of the
background information on your interactions with the select committee so that we can be
clear about where we stand as of today.
The select committee's investigative staff contacted you in October of 2021.
Between October 2021 and March 2022, through your counsel, you voluntarily turned
over more than 8,000 pages of documents that were associated with you and Turning
Point entities.
employees about arranging bus transportation to and from the January 6th Ellipse rally.
These were largely email communications among Turning Point
In March of 2022, your counsel informed the select committee that you would not
voluntarily sit for an interview, and for that reason the select committee issued a
subpoena to compel your testimony and ensure the completion of your document
production.
Now, I'll say that your counsel have informed us, Mr. Kirk, that you will be refusing
to answer any questions today pursuant to the Fifth Amendment.
Is that correct as a general matter?
A
Yes.
Q
Now, be that as it may, we are hoping once you hear some of our questions
that you will choose to answer.
investigation, and we hope that you will consider whether you will actually answer the
questions.
These are questions that are within the scope of our
Be that as it may, if you have a privilege assertion such as the Fifth Amendment,
you must assert it for the record in response to questions as appropriate.
I will also note that the Fifth Amendment provides a witness the ability to refuse
to answer a question if they have a reasonable belief that a truthful answer could be used
against them in a criminal prosecution, not simply because the witness would prefer not
to answer the question.
Mr. Kirk, do you understand that?
A
On advice of counsel, I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right not to testify
and decline to answer the question.
Q
Now, before I move on to substantive questions, I took the liberty of
outlining some of the procedural history.
opportunity to say anything for the record that they might want to add to that.
I do want to give your attorneys an
It's okay if you want to wait to do that until the end because I didn't give you a
heads-up on that.
the background that got us to today, I'm happy to let you say something.
Mr. Levy.
But Josh or Jeff, if there's anything that you want to add in terms of
Thank you,
The background in terms of Mr. Kirk and Turning Point's cooperation with the
select committee has been memorialized in a number of writings and letters, including
the letter of March 16th, 2022, and the letter of May 16th, 2022, and the record of
cooperation in full as stated in those letters.
entered into the record and allow them to speak for themselves.
That's fine with me, Josh.
And so I would ask that those letters be
I'll tell you that we do have a few exhibits to look at today.
I don't know if we'll look at every single one.
Those are numbered
through exhibit 14.
those two letters exhibits 15 and 16 so that those can be referenced as part of the
deposition record.
Was there anything else, Josh?
Mr. Levy.
No.
But we will make
Thank you.
Q
Mr. Kirk, how old are you?
A
On advice of counsel, I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right not to testify
and decline to answer the question.
Q
In what State do you reside?
A
I live in currently Scottsdale, Arizona, Phoenix, Arizona.
Q
And what is your highest level of education?
A
On advice of counsel, I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right not to testify
and decline to answer the question.
Q
Mr. Kirk, you are a founder and the executive director of an entity called
Turning Point USA, correct?
A
On advice of counsel, I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right not to testify
and decline to answer the question.
Q
correct?
A
And you are also the founder of an entity called Turning Point Action,
On advice of counsel, I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right not to testify
and decline to answer the question.
Q
Mr. Kirk, I'll tell you that if you would like to shorten your response to invoke
the Fifth Amendment to something that is not as wordy as that to save some time, I'm
fine with that, and we will understand that you mean the full statement that you have
made.
So you can, moving forward, simply say, "I invoke the Fifth Amendment," if that
makes sense and that way -- we will not treat that response differently than the other
responses you've already given.
I do have some exhibits to share and show you.
I'm going to start with exhibit 1.
You should be able to see on your screen here some documents that I'm sharing.
apologize.
Hold on one second.
There we go.
Mr. Kirk, can you see these documents that are on the screen?
A
Yes, I can.
Q
So, Mr. Kirk, this is a copy of the subpoena that was issued to you by the
select committee.
decline a voluntarily interview.
production of documents and testifying for a deposition.
As I mentioned before, we issued this in response to your decision to
You can see here that the subpoena called for the
I'm going to go forward here towards the end of this document.
It has what we
refer to here as a document schedule.
You can see under schedule A a command to you
to produce certain documents and communications in your possession, and covering
roughly four categories -- I'm sorry -- more than four categories, but specific to the
January 6th rally and events leading up to it.
As I mentioned before, your counsel produced several thousand documents in
response to the requests that were outlined in this schedule.
This is identical to the
voluntary document request that was made last fall.
were no text messages included, and your counsel have conveyed to us that you do not
have any text messages from the relevant period in your possession.
We noted in the production there
Is that correct?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
When did you delete those text messages?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
We also noted that there are no messages from alternative messaging
applications, such as Telegram, Signal, WhatsApp, those kinds of applications.
Mr. Kirk, did you use any such messaging applications to communicate about
subjects that are outlined in the subpoena?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
I'm going to show you what's been marked as exhibit 2.
Mr. Kirk, I can represent to you these are text messages produced by a woman
named Amy Kremer, and the document suggests that these are text messages between
Ms. Kremer and a user that she had saved in her phone as Charlie Kirk.
And you can see here, December 21st, 2020, Amy sends a message, says, "Hey,
Charlie.
Can you speak at the March for Trump rally on Jan 6th in D.C.?"
after that, "Please give me a call.
Then, 2 days
Thanks."
Mr. Kirk, did you speak with Ms. Kremer about speaking at the January 6th event?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Do you recall the first time that you were asked to participate in events on
January 6th, 2021?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Going to show you now exhibit 3.
Caroline Wren.
These are text messages produced by
Do you know Ms. Wren?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
She's represented to us that these are communications with you.
You can
see here that the contact is saved in her phone as Charlie with an image that appears to
be you.
December 15th, 2020.
And I'll just read you the first couple of text messages here that start
At about 12:25 p.m., Ms. Wren texts you, "Do you know Julie Fancelli?"
And she
explains who this woman is, that she's given money to President Trump.
She says -- Ms.
Wren says, "She's going to come Thursday through Sunday for SAS and asks for wire
transfer info because she's interested in donating money to your entities."
Mr. Kirk, SAS, does that refer to the Student Action Summit held by Turning Point?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
The Student Action Summit in December 2020 was held in West Palm Beach,
Florida, right?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did you meet with Ms. Fancelli or Ms. Wren at the 2020 SAS?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, you see here in this message Ms. Wren writes, "If you meet with her,"
meaning Ms. Fancelli, "for 5 minutes at some point, she would do a minimum" -- I'm
sorry.
Let me back up.
Ms. Wren says, "I was going to tell her to send you $50,000 today, and then if you
meet with her for 5 minutes at some point she would do minimum $250,000
guaranteed."
During the 2020 Student Action Summit, did you discuss any conversations that
you needed to have with Ms. Fancelli to secure donations from her?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
We can see here on page 2, the Charlie Kirk user sends to Ms. Wren wiring
instructions for Turning Point Action.
Are these wiring instructions sent from you to Ms. Wren?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
On page 3 of exhibit 3, here on December 26th, the conversation continues
about Ms. Fancelli.
money?"
On the 23rd of December you wrote, "Did your friend give us
Three days later Ms. Wren responds, "I'm actually sitting with her now.
all doing any sort of effort to bring folks out to D.C. for January 6th protests?
you can.
Are you
Call me if
She's ready to invest."
And in response you write, "Nothing for Jan 6th.
Mr. Kirk, why at this point was Turning Point not involved in planning any efforts
Can call soon."
for January 6th, 2021?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
We can scroll down here on page 4 of this exhibit, Ms. Wren shares with you
a contact card in the iMessage for Julie Fancelli, and in response on December 26th you
write back, "Called her.
No response."
December 26th, later in the day, you ask Ms. Wren to call you back.
And she
writes back, "Went to voicemail."
At the bottom of this page 4, Ms. Wren writes to you, "Can you send me a quick
paragraph to describe what you would spend the 1.5 million on?
1.25 to Turning Point Action and 250K to Turning Point USA."
I'm going to suggest
What happened between December 26th and December 27th that you went from
doing nothing in response for January 6th to being involved in planning support for
January 6th?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
And I should've gone here to page 5 to clarify that, because you write back,
"An investment of $1,250,000 for TPA will allow us to deploy social media influencers to
Washington, D.C., on Jan 6th, produce high-quality capturing video content that will
educate millions about the significance of Jan 6th, mobilize students to fight against voter
fraud, as well help expand Turning Point Action's campus army towards the President's
America first goals/objectives."
So is it fair to say, Mr. Kirk, that you only decided to be involved in supporting
January 6th once it was clear that Ms. Fancelli was going to provide a substantial
donation to enable that participation?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
At the bottom of page 5 of this exhibit, on December 28th in the morning,
Ms. Wren writes, "POTUS is now speaking on January 6th, so we need this to be a very
legit operation and crowd building.
Can we step up TPUSA involvement?
I'm not comfortable with these other organizations.
Also, I think you need to speak."
In response you write back, "Who told you he is speaking?"
Ms. Wren says, "White House.
We had to move the location, have been dealing
with Secret Service all day, moving the permits into our name."
And you write back, "I find it hard to believe that he will speak."
First, did Ms. Wren ever tell you who from the White House conveyed to her the
President would speak on January 6th?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Mr. Kirk, why did you find it hard to believe the President was going to be
speaking on January 6th?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, I'll just give you the synopsis here of the following parts of the text
message exchange.
You can see here that on December 28th in the afternoon there's discussions
about the details that go into sending the wire transfer to Turning Point Action.
Ms. Wren then confirms that someone you got contacted by named Marianne
Parsons is someone who works for Ms. Fancelli as an accountant and goes on to talk
about the details of how the wire transfers would be effected to Turning Point Action and
Turning Point USA with Ms. Parsons' help.
On page 8, Ms. Wren sends you a budget.
"Turning Point Action budget."
in response you wrote, "I can't live by that budget.
You can see there's an image here,
And we can't see the details of this, but we do know that
It's 6 days away."
Mr. Kirk, do you recall what about this budget was problematic for you?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
At the bottom of this page, on December 29th, you write to Ms. Wren, "I am
not speaking at the event."
Mr. Kirk, why did you decide not to speak at the January 6th event?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did you have concerns over how the January 6th event was being organized?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Mr. Kirk, did you have concerns over potential unrest or violence on
January 6th?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
In response, after you say you're not speaking at the event, Ms. Wren says,
"Please call Marianne," with the prayer hands emoji.
And then you write back, "I did," and said, "No response."
Then in subsequent days you ask her -- ask Ms. Wren --
please."
"Check Telegram
And on January 4th you write, "No answer from Julie."
Did anyone ask you to reconsider your decision not to speak at the event after
that text message saying, "I'm not going to speak"?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Do you recall Marianne's or Ms. Fancelli's reaction to hearing that you were
not going to speak at this event?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, you can see there on January 3rd you wrote to Ms. Wren, "Check
Telegram, please."
Why did you tell Ms. Wren to check Telegram?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Did you use Telegram to communicate about the rally?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, as I indicated earlier, at the start of the deposition, Mr. Kirk, there
were no messages, text messages, messaging application documents that were produced.
And so our assumption is that, because your attorneys have certified compliance with the
subpoena, that you do not have any Telegram communications in your possession.
Is that correct?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
We'll move on here to exhibit 4.
Q
This is a document that Ms. Fancelli received from Caroline Wren.
You can see
the top of exhibit 4, page 1 says, "Fancelli budget and trip plan for Monday, January 4th,
through Wednesday, January 6th."
events to attend.
And this first page has an itinerary of different
The second page includes a budget and trip plan.
And you can see here, the very
top line of this exhibit -- and I can zoom in, I think -- includes a line item here for Turning
Point Action, $1 million.
the text message that you sent to Ms. Wren when she asked you for an explanation of
how you would spend money from Ms. Fancelli.
And it gives an explanation that I can tell you generally tracks
So did Ms. Wren discuss with you that she would include the explanation that you
gave her in a budget and trip proposal for Ms. Fancelli?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, if you recall, the original discussion with Ms. Wren on the text
messages was for $1.25 million and this budget is for $1 million.
amount in the budget is less than the amount originally discussed in the text messages?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
I'll show you exhibit 5.
Do you know why the
Exhibit 5 is a Gmail email thread that shows a brief
email thread between Caroline Wren, Justin Caporale, who's an event planner with Event

Ms. Wren writes to Mr. Caporale and asks, "Please send Charlie the invoice and expense
breakdown for the $211,931.33 payment needed for the January 6th build-out.
invoice should be made to Turning Point Action."
And you can see here, on Thursday, December 31st,
In response you wrote, "Yes."
And then Justin writes back, "Thank you.
The
Charlie, can you send me the legal
entity name so he can create a client profile?
And then he'll send a full invoice."
also explains additional costs that will be associated because of the floor covering
required by NPS, which is the National Park Service."
And in response you say, "Turning Point Action.
Ask Caroline."
And
And Ms. Wren
provides additional information about Turning Point's mailing address for the customer
profile.
So, Mr. Kirk, this was a payment associated with the production of the January 6th
rally at the Ellipse, correct?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, you were able, through Turning Point, to provide these funds because
of a donation from Ms. Fancelli, correct?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
We can take a look at exhibit 6.
Exhibit 6 is an email.
The original emails
start on December 30th from Mr. Caporale to the Kremers, Amy Kremer and Kylie Jane

entity that received the permit for the Ellipse rally.
planner people, including Ms. Wren and Tim Unes and Charles Carbone.
And then there is a forward of that.
And then copying some of the event
We understand that this is forwarded to you
from Ms. Wren on December 31st saying she wants to review the budget with you, saying
event production costs are getting high due to Secret Service and Park Service's
requirements, and she asks if you're comfortable with the budget that is laid out below in
the email.
And you can see that it includes, we'll say, roughly $411,000 for Event Strategies,
$50,000 for Bluebonnet Fundraising, which is the LLC where Ms. Wren establishes for her
own fundraising work, some miscellaneous money that's held back for unforeseen costs,
and then you can see $250,000 for Turning Point Action busing and event promotion, and
then $250,000 for Turning Point Action with nothing associated with it, not designated.
Did this track with the costs that you were predicting around this time for the
event?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
And you can also see up here on January 3rd Ms. Wren gives you a budget
update and also she says, "Attaches an invoice for Bluebonnet," and then also says for Tru
Media, T-r-u, for Don/KG speaker's fees.
$60,000 to Tru Media for speaking fees.
And you can see the explanation of that is
Did you agree to pay $60,000 in speaking fees for Donald Trump, Jr. and Kimberly

A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Exhibit 7 is another email thread.
her associates.
accountant who works for her.
Ms. Parsons, "I need to send $250,000 to Charlie Kirk ASAP."
This one's provided by Ms. Fancelli and
The email is between Ms. Fancelli and Marianne Parsons, who's the
And on January 4th at 11:39 p.m. Ms. Fancelli writes to
Ms. Parsons' response, "Is this to Turning Point Action where you gave him
$1 million last week?"
Ms. Fancelli writes back:
"I think so.
It is for busing in more people.
Call him.
Do you have his number?"
And then this is then forwarded from Ms. Parsons to people who are associated

Did you tell Ms. Fancelli or Caroline Wren that the original $1 million was not

A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Because as you'll see from the email that we just looked as with Ms. Wren
that the budget she had given to you for the spending of a million dollars already included

enough for the busing and promotion for January 6th?
So was that original $250,000 not
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Exhibit 8, Mr. Kirk, this is an email that's sent from you to Marianne Parsons,

subject line "Confidential," and there's an Excel attachment to it.
You write, "Hi, Marianne.
Please see the attached.
incurred, the total comes to $975,941 spent thus far."
spreadsheet.
With recent legal costs
And the attachment here is a
I can tell you that you can see from the -- we call these Bates stamps in the
bottom right corner of the document.
because this is produced by your counsel on behalf of Turning Point.
documents that were produced by your lawyers on your behalf.
It says "TPA."
That's Bates stamped that way
So these are
Our understanding is that the redactions, the blacked-out lines, have been
conveyed to us were not costs associated with January 6th.
So we're left to understand
that the things that are shown are costs that were associated with the January 6th rally?
And you can see here that these columns have the date, the type of payment, the

categorizes -- the expense.
And then there's an info category that generally characterizes -- or
And so, for example, on line 7, you can see there is an $83,877 payment to Shofur,

So we've gone through and we've added up everything that says "buses" on this
spreadsheet.
That figure comes out to less than $250,000.
So can you help us understand why there would have been a need for an
additional $250,000 on top of the million dollars that was already provided by Ms.
Fancelli?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
And the reason we ask that is because we're just trying to understand the
logistics and costs that were associated with bringing people to Washington, D.C., and
whether those efforts were successful, that kind of thing.
So any clarity that you'd be willing to provide on that would be very helpful to us.
But I understand that you're going to invoke the Fifth Amendment as to that question.
Is that correct?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, I mentioned before Tru Media.
Exhibit 9 is an invoice from Tru Media
LLC, with an address in New York, New York, billed to Turning Point Action, with a date of
January 2nd, 2021.
strategic advisory, promotion, keynote speeches by Kimberly Guilfoyle and Donald
Trump, Jr. on January 6th, 2021, for the total dollar amount of $60,000."
The description on this invoice says, "March to Save America,
So did you discuss strategy for January 6th with Ms. Guilfoyle or Mr. Trump?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
And did you agree to pay these individuals for their speeches on January 6th,
as opposed to payments for other services that they may have provided to Turning Point
previously?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
I understand that they also had -- "they" meaning Ms. Guilfoyle and Mr.
Trump -- had participated in some capacity at the Student Action Summit in West Palm
Beach the month prior where they also had been anticipating receiving payment for that
participation.
Mr. Kirk, if someone said that this $60,000 payment that's listed as January 6th
was actually reimbursement for speaking at the Student Action Summit in December,
would that be true?
A
I'm invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
Now, as has been mentioned a bunch of times already, we understand
Turning Point helped to coordinate bus transportation to the January 6th event.
Who from Turning Point was responsible at a leadership level for coordinating
that bus transportation to Washington, D.C., for that day?
A
I am invoking my Fifth Amendment right.
Q
I'm going to show you exhibit 10.
This is a tweet -- I apologize.
This is
actually from a website called Archive.erg.
that it works is it essentially will crawl the internet and take screenshots or images of
websites historically over time.
And you may be familiar with it, but the way
And so I think you probably understand that this particular tweet that we're
looking at here by you was subsequently deleted.
is not, as you can see here from the language on it, from a United States-based website,
because there's an abbreviation for January that's not English.
guess -- well, I guess I could say that the like appears to be j'aime for French.
this is a French website.
So the archived version that we have
And I won't hazard a
So maybe
But in any event, I just say that to point out that I can't tell you exactly what time
it was because the 1743 time stamp is likely the local time where the website was being
archived from.
handle, tweeted on January 4th, "This historic event will likely be one of the largest and
most consequential in American history.
Action are honored to help make this happen, sending 80-plus buses full of patriots to
D.C. to fight for this President."
But in any event, you can see here @charliekirk11, which is your Twitter
The team @TrumpStudents and Turning Point
